abstract_ssm: Richard Wagner (1813-1883) was a German composer. Rena Charnin Mueller is an associate professor of music at New York University. The Richard Wagner Manuscripts include two items handwritten by Wagner. One item is a song written by Wagner, dedicated to Louis [Kn]ass.  The other item is a poem invitation to celebrate the completion of Die Götterdämmerung, with a list on its verso of potential singers for the first complete production of Der Ring des Nibelungen at Bayreuth, Germany, written by Anton Seidl with notations by Wagner.
persname_ssm: Wagner, Richard, 1813-1883 -- Der Ring des Nibelungen.

name_sim: Wagner, Richard, 1813-1883 -- Der Ring des Nibelungen.
